info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 06 at 5:43PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Robeson County through 630 PM EDT... At 542 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Fairmont, or 9 miles south of Lumberton, moving northwest at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 45 mph and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Lumberton, Pembroke, Fairmont, Rowland, Purvis, Hestertown, Barnesville, Elrod, Proctorville, Mcdonald, Orrum and Raynham. This includes Interstate 95 in North Carolina between mile markers 3 and 18. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to brief localized flooding and ponding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
